channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road closed for months causing chaos, 14th January
item.description:
This road has been closed for months and I'm the icy conditions is causing chaos getting into cleeve because you can't use Gambles Lane in icy conditions and there are more roadworks on Southam lane causing chaos trying to get down Kayte Lane. I live in Winchcombe so either have to go that way or Gotherington and that road is currently closed too. If you look at a map of cleeve/gotherington you will see all the roadworks and you are now planning on closing gambles Lane in the coming weeks making it almost impossible to get into cleeve which I have to do daily
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks around Cleeve causing problems getting into the village, 14th January
item.description:
These roadworks are causing chaos and there is no work even being done. You cannot get into Bishops Cleeve because there are roadworks on Southam road, Cheltenham Road and New Road is also blocked by roadworks with nothing happening. Please please reopen these roads properly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on Cheltenham road, 14th January
item.description:
On Cheltenham road in bishops Cleeve opposite esso petrol station. Has been for ages and is getting deeper and wider. At night difficult to see, affecting car suspension
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Ditch right across road, 13th January
item.description:
This was part of road which was dug up last year to put in new pipe but the trench was never properly finished off and it is opening up again - looking at previous reports it looks as though it has been closed but certainly hasnt been fixed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple large pot holes, 13th January
item.description:
Multiple large pot holes have opened up again over an area that was already repaired going uphill on the dual carriageway towards Northleach. Completely impossible to avoid and very dangerous going round corner at high speeds when trying to swerve round them. Please repair with something more permanent. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many potholes - photos attached., 13th January
item.description:
Unfortunately itâ€™s not possible to attach photos of all the potholes. The surface is all broken up now and an accident/damage waiting to happen. Please please can some warning signage be provided, and a plan communicated regarding resurfacing of this street which is a through road. Suggest an advisory speed limit should also be posted with loose gravel warning signs. Potholes outside: 5 17 25 31 35 38 41 45 Whittington Road. Benhall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface, 13th January
item.description:
The entirety of the road on Victoria Place is in a sorry state. It probably needs resurfacing as it is extremely dangerous in its current state. I see this issue has been reported before, however, it hasn't yet been addressed and the situation is worsening throughout the winter. Throughout the last couple of months I have seen at least two people burst their bike tyres on the surface. Fortunately nobody was hurt. Please address this. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Victoria Place, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entire street beyond terrible state of the road, 13th January
item.description:
Almost the entire street, but particularly between number 45 - 53 Keynsham Street, have terrible terrible road situation which is constantly causing huge damage to cars and I am concerned about a sink hole too. The damage has been caused in large part by Severn Trent digging up the street so many times to fix water issues and never making the street smooth again. It is shockingly bad.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Keynsham Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Runnings Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Flytipping just before entrance to fields, 13th January
item.description:
General waste scattered been there for a while , then noticed a huge bundle of cables bumped very near that has been chucked over low fence in same area in Manor Road. Very unsightly and dangerous to wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
